After playing Overwatch 1 and Overwatch 2 (on battlenet) I can only recommend this game if you want a mindless shooter.
Pick up this game and have a friend to talk to in the background. There is no sense of accomplishment when playing the game. You don't feel you are getting better at the game because you heavily rely on teammates doing their job.
The only reason to play solo is for costumes, which is an atrocious reason. I would rather like the feeling of getting better at something than being rewarded with meaningless garbage.
People generally don't chat nor talk, it feels like playing with bots. This is why I recommend having a friend to talk to.

Imagine charging customers for content you've promised to deliver which you later cancel AND then refuse to refund the money stolen.
Absolute disgrace of a company who also jumped on the money-milking paywall train - seems like EA teached them a lesson or two on how to become one of the most hated companies out there. 
Great job on killing the game, brand and the community which made you the most success over the years, but absolutely not suprising since Blizzard manages to f*ck up most of their games.

[h1] 操你妈的暴雪 、操你妈的守望先锋[/h1]
以前1的时候更新慢（其实是几乎不更新只是翻来覆去炒冷饭）后面服务器也垃圾 然后还吊着玩家胃口说要出2 全新的pve模式 让玩家还期待着你这个畜生还可以像2016的守望先锋一样
事实是你让无数曾经热爱喜欢这款游戏的玩家从心怀希望到不在抱有期待（即使这样在当时还是有一小部分玩家喜欢守望先锋的比如我这个傻逼）
你这个杂种东西拖了又拖 最后出了个我以为是赛季更新一样的半成品（守望先锋 2 ）
 6v6改成了5v5  T一掉直接没法打  全队靠T活着 小美冰冻没了 麦克雷闪没了  对于我个人来说 我不介意他增强或者削弱我更觉得这是这个英雄的特色 很遗憾他们都随着你的母亲一起消失了 
离谱的是拿着pve打广告的守望先锋2居然没有上线pve模式
当年说的天赋树养成什么的也权当放屁了
就算你pve什么的不更新 pvp能不能他妈的整点活啊 你看看人家隔壁的apex就一个大逃杀
守望先锋这游戏最主要的还是pvp啊 哪怕你把天赋树搞到pvp出个娱乐呢
出了几个对称的地图 把原本免费获得的币子删除 箱子删除 免费的皮肤改收费（其实花很长时间也可以肝出来 但是我就是不爽 就是想操他妈）就当是2了是吧
游戏里的爽点都砍没了我还玩你妈 你媳妇跟黑人通奸至残 你还捧着她当宝？
还有之前网易暴雪的事件 暴雪的嘴脸大家也都看到了 
真是让人恶心
守望先锋其实很早就开始变了 
比如说安娜 破坏球 莫伊到后面的逆天铁拳小锤 （老玩家应该知道在当时那个和尚天使dj的时代 出了安娜是什么感受 奶量的变化多明显）
算了不想打字了 懒得吐槽这垃圾东西了
以上内容如果你反驳我玩的菜说我不懂这款游戏的话 
那我只好诚恳的邀请你好好的品尝这坨藏污纳垢多年肮脏至极的烂狗屎
[h1] 操你妈的暴雪 、操你妈的守望先锋[/h1]

I’ve been very excited to write this review. My current play time according to blizzard is 141hrs 25minutes 12seconds however it is much closer to triple this but for some reason blizzard hasn’t logged all my play time. 

This review has been long in the making as there has been no official way to display opinions on the game until blizzard finally made the mistake in releasing to steam. Expect this review to be long so I’ll write a TLDR at the start of this review.

TLDR: Lied to by omission on features promised that never arrived – these features are the reason that overwatch 1 was replaced with a 2 rather than a needed rework. A single skin can cost more than a several whole loot boxes with several skins in each sometimes upwards of £20 per skin in overwatch 2. New characters are required for PVP competitive gameplay (which you need to pay for to be able to play) as they are made to be overpowered to force them into the meta. Also, you are restricted in playing with friends at higher levels. Avoid, devs lie and items are overcharged – pay to win. Many have been conned into giving OW2 money expecting that they were paying for PVE, which is the reason why the game was re worked as overwatch 2 

I was an early adopter and played from the very start of overwatch when the games were 6v6 and there were no restrictions on which hero to play. From the get go we had an incredible world with an in depth story but surface level shallow game play with few mods, no PVE (obviously I mean PVE as in the standard use for the term where by in players would have repayable missions against NPCs and Ais in an RPG style game) however Blizzard realised they could make some cash from the game and started to adapt the in game restrictions to allow for more creative team composition and actual strategy although there was massive push back against the community to have; 

-	Consistent communication about the progression of the game
-	An actual point to the maps that were dropped and the game as a whole.
-	Issues with characters past and present
-	Timeline for new characters and general additions to the game

Skipping forward to the poor release of game breaking characters and poorly optimised releases that broke team composition and playability (brig and every instance of a shield after her) there were massive drops in the player base and a massive foreshadowing to the future issues in overwatch 2 which is why this context is important; the devs where not in control – the higher ups were pulling resources away for other things. 

Adjustments were sloppy and ineffective as the original team working on overwatch started to grow smaller and be replaced with other devs. And as early as 2018 we have now heard that this direct lack of input into overwatch 1 was caused by forced start on a new version of overwatch – named overwatch 2. 

Eventually we were promised features for overwatch 2 – promised functionality and the replay ability that should have been there from the start of overwatch 1 to support the massive lore that the blizzard boasted. We were promised:

-	Customisable hero’s equipment
-	Talent trees
-	Repayable PVE missions
-	New characters
-	A campaign
-	A shop where you can singularly purchase items instead of a loot box system.
-	Reworked game engine from the ground up
-	5v5
-	Hero reworks

All of these things, according to the staff at blizzard, was a start to a larger vision of an MMO style game. These changes were meant to justify the release of overwatch 2 and not as a game rework. However, as verbally confirmed by blizzard, before they even released overwatch 2 was that they could not follow through with nearly any of the PVE or campaign that they promised but still attempted to sell us a “2” on the end of overwatch. More on this later as in the timeline we are unaware of these changes behind the scenes and are still buying into the idea of what overwatch is supposed to be.

Thankfully this content was meant to replace the boring and abandoned original overwatch game and essentially game functionality that hardly matches the lore even after 5 years - I mean, can you imagine a game that barely works, capture the point or cart escort missions are essentially the only content, a game cluttered in special effects, AOE healing and ultimate’s that blocked out or straight up replaced the sun but with lore, comics and backstory animations that has animators across the country sweating in delight… it doesn’t match.
 
So, onto a more functional review of what Overwatch 2 is. It’s a 5v5 version of the 6v6 in overwatch with one tank, so naturally characters had to be reworked to accommodate for this single tank rather than the usual 2 – so let’s not give blizzard credit for their extensive character reworks – they had to do this. Not to mention the 2 characters that were so broken on launch that they had to be removed for weeks to allow for fixes. 

Overwatch 2 has a shop where purchasing single items is now so overpriced you could have bought several loot boxes with a level of certainty for the rarity you wanted. Some keen eyes youtubers and content creators have managed to find moments where the items were double listed, listed for different prices in different sections. Someone recently worked out (google it for specifics) that if you were to have played ALL missions that give you free coins (the currency that purchases overwatch 2 gear) and saved all your coins since launch you would only just now be able to get your first gold tier item.

The missing PVE that we were expecting is still missing and instead we were given smaller tiny unrepayable missions that are basically the same as the hated overwatch 1 seasonal mini games for Halloween and their anniversary events. 

Competitive play is now pay to pay not just pay to win – you unlock the new characters with a £10 fee or many hours of hard graft to unlock the character. For someone that is relatively skilled at games but doesn’t have time to grind to unlock characters that are designed to be required it’s a huge put off seeing how little you can accomplish towards your goal before the timer runs out and you lose out. Its shameful and depressing. 

The current roster is dominated with an unbalanced mess of characters that were never truly thought through. For example, mercy has been a touchy subject for a long time – she damage boosts other characters and thus creates a NEED for her to be paired with some DPS’s. 

after booting overwatch 2 its also amazingly obvious that blizzard is trying to pull in some of its lost audience from the deletion of its full pve content with a section called "progression" but this is only a surface level badge you can get from completing achievements per character / class / game type eg quick play or comp that has no real meaning to in game experiences. So there really is no progression system its a glorified cosmetic badge unlock similar to the overwatch 1 badge system but that only shows you play one character / class or game mode more than others. 

I loved playing overwatch 1 although limited it did have its ups and downs. I found friends from abroad that I travelled to see, I created a discord who had hundreds of like-minded people join and play overwatch and other games. the community although guided poorly by a poorly made game that allowed abusive commentary, poor ranking, limited gameplay, cluttered effects, one trick obsessive players and awful update cycle was still a decent place to talk – overwatch 2 was a great lie designed to get money from us whilst holding onto the promise of a better future.
